subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] New poll for Read_Alphabet
msgSnippet: Hello I had some problems with my Yahoogroups account and I cannot access to it for 24 hours. That s why I ll answer here. Another reason is that the question
messageBody:
Hello

I had some problems with my Yahoogroups account and I cannot access to it for 24 hours. That's why I'll answer here. Another reason is that the question is not as easily “answerable” as you might think.

First, the Quikscript alphabet has not yet been included in Unicode. Hence it is not possible to “write Unicode Quickscript” at all.

Perhaps there's a font somewhere with QS in the Private Use Area. If so, I'd like a link to download it. Is it complete with all the half letters, variant forms, x-ligatures and Scottish ll and ch letters?

If such a font exists and provided that I know where to find it, I could download it and install it on my computers, on Linux and on Windows. I have no Mac now.

The only problem, very easily solvable on some systems, is the lack of suitable keyboard driver.
There are programs to create keyboard drivers.
On Windows, you can use the Microsoft Keyboard Layout Creator (MSKLC), which is free, the Windows Driver Kit (WDK), Tavultesoft Keyman or a few other programs.
On Mac OS, there's a useful program called Ukelele.
On Linux, you'd have to create and/or modify some configuration files. That's not very difficult once you have spend a little time to understand how that works.
I read that's more problematic on Haiku, but I've never tried that system.

JF



On 20 juin 11 00:16 Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com wrote:
Enter your vote today! A new poll has been created for the
Read_Alphabet group:

Can you write Unicode Quickscript on your computer?

o Yes
o No


To vote, please visit the following web page:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/surveys?id=3051193

Note: Please do not reply to this message. Poll votes are
not collected via email. To vote, you must go to the Yahoo! Groups
web site listed above.

Thanks!
